item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Only the phoenix rises and does not descend. And everything changes. And nothing is truly lost." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn't carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life." -- Stephen King

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you." -- Stephen King

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Speaking personally, you can have my gun, but you'll take my book when you pry my cold, dead fingers off of the binding." -- Stephen King

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All my best thoughts were stolen by the ancients." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description:
"On Undecided Voter​s: "To put them in perspective, I think​ of being​ on an airplane.​ The flight attendant comes​ down the aisle​ with her food cart and, eventually,​ parks​ it beside my seat.​ “Can I inter​est you in the chick​en?​” she asks.​ “Or would​ you prefer the platter of shit with bits of broke​n glass​ in it?”
To be undecided in this elect​ion is to pause​ for a moment and then ask how the chick​en is cooked." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "When asked "What do we need to learn this for?" any high-school teacher can confidently answer that, regardless of the subject, the knowledge will come in handy once the student hits middle age and starts working crossword puzzles in order to stave off the terrible loneliness." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by oscar wilde
item.description: "You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear." -- oscar wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "This wallpaper is dreadful, one of us will have to go." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never put off till tomorrow what I can possibly do - the day after." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The world was my oyster but I used the wrong fork." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Hear no evil, speak no evil, and you won't be invited to cocktail parties." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Some things are too important to be taken seriously." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you are not long, I will wait for you all my life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The world is a stage and the play is badly cast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde
